text:
MARK A. KAESTNER: When I
joined Coca-Cola a little

over a decade ago, I
was located in Dallas,

and our corporate
headquarters is in Atlanta.

And so it was one of
those opportunities

where I had to be very
agile and learn myself.

And it was interesting because
everybody has a different style
and a different adaptation.

And so I have one
associate that really

likes formal one-on-one calendar
time where it's set aside

and it's dedicated for us
to have the opportunity
to connect.

I have another associate that
likes it very informal and very

frequent, and I
check in with them
several times during the week.

Also, I think one of the things
that I learned right away

was that when you're
physically together,

you're able to see
the body language.

You're able to read
facial expressions,

and you can connect
in a different way.

One of the things
that I learned was

to be able to be very present
when you're connecting

virtually, and what I
mean by being present

is asking a lot of questions,
seeking to understand,

doing the pause, which sometimes
can be very uncomfortable,

but it allows the space for each
of you to think but then also
to react to each other.

So one of the things
that I definitely do

is to have that opportunity
where I create the space where
we can reflect and connect.
